page.title: 12Huntley Manor and Estate
page.content: We visited{Huntley Manor House}and were shown round by the present owner. Her father had planted most of{Newent {Woods}and the estate was very large. Changes have taken place recently and the estate has been divided up with several firms holding interests.{ {Huntley Manor House}was built in the 19th Century for the then Rector Rev. H. Miles and used as his home. We saw some lovely stained glass windows in the house and the present owner's family crest. As well as{Huntley Manor the owner owns{Woodend Farm,Huntley {School of Equitation}and quantities of woodland. The farm is 550 acres and there are over 1500 acres of{woodland. {Forestry}is important and we found out that recently replanting has been mainly hardwoods. We saw the new areas of cultivation and the site where felled timber is sawn up and treated.
